data.description:
Traffic information for Luxembourg motorways on your wrist!
Data is fetched from http://cita.lu.
This app is unofficial and NOT in any way supported or endorsed by the Administration des ponts et chaussées, Luxembourg.

Features:

- Incidents:
Displays a list of current traffic incidents. Select an entry to view its details in a scrollable card.

- Travel times:
Displays a list of current travel times for a few destinations from several places. Select a starting place in the list to view the complete card.

- Webcams:
Choose from a variety of traffic monitoring webcams to show on the Pebble screen. Due to the limited resolution and color palette, image quality may suffer. Best results achieved during daylight hours.
A few "hotspots" (busiest junctions) are promoted to the top of the menu to quickly access webcams around these areas in a sub-menu. Alternatively, the list is also sorted by motorway.

data.description:
Modes: clock, stopwatch, and countdown (with overtime count-up).

At the top right, in all modes, is a linear display of  the hour, minutes, and seconds. All modes also show the UTC(z) hour, the date and day, sunrise and sunset, temperature, two user-info text fields, and status icons for stopwatch, countdown, Bluetooth, and battery. Clock mode also displays the day's percent change in the DJIA and NASDAQ.

Chromochrome vibrates on the hour (in clock mode), and upon Bluetooth disconnection, starting the stopwatch or countdown, and countdown completion.

If you exit and reenter the app, the stopwatch and countdown times will be as if the app had been running all along.

You can choose 12- or 24-hour format (defaults to watch default), force-refresh the stock data, select Celsius or Fahrenheit, and change the text of the user-info fields.

Buttons: Top, Middle, Bottom

M: cycles   -> clock-> stpw -> ctdn ->

clock:
T: select setting-submode for clock -> stocks -> temp -> info1 -> info2
clock: B: toggle 12/24hr mode
stocks: B: force refresh (if BT connected)
temp: B: toggle C/F
M: exit setting-submode

usrinfo:
 B: update usrinfo field, select 1st char
   T: select next char (at end of field, go to 2nd field or exit setting-submode)
   B: modify selected char:
     if a-z, uppercasify
     then cycle through space, a-z, 0-9, and .+-_@#

stpw:
T: stop -> reset
B: start/resume

ctdn:
counting down: T: stop -> reset -> init
overtime: T: reset -> init
B: start/resume

ctdn init:
T: select next digit
B: inc selected digit
M: exit init

data.description:
Time Helper is an app for telling time through vibrations. When run, Time Helper appears to be one of the Pebble's watchfaces. However, unlike a standard watchface, the app will vibrate distinctly every quarter hour. If you press the middle right button while the app is running, the app will pulse the minutes of the hour. If you press the top right button, a special "Focus" mode will be toggled. When on, the app will vibrate every minute. This feature is intended to help you track time when every minute counts.

See this Medium story for more details: https://medium.com/ben-and-dion/feeling-time-378e44e31ee0

data.author: Pete Gestewitz
data.description:
You thought that calculators were your friends, but now your parent's generation smokes you at basic math. You're taking Calculus, but customers at your minimum wage job are still telling you how to make change.

You're better than that. Program your mind with +/-, a stupidly simple (yet surprisingly addictive) left-brain exercising piece of gym kit.

1.) You'll be presented with two random numbers. If the numbers are blue, add. If they're red, subtract.
2.) Select button shows you what you claim you already knew.
3.) Up button lets you work addition problems, down is for subtraction.

Updates are coming soon, because you and I both need work on multiplication and division.

<3 @petegeste

data.description:
Activity monitor for Pebble watch.
This is a beta app. Please test it and leave feedback.

Current features:
Activity detection: walk, run, sleep and steps taken.
Idle alerts: configurable time.
Smart alarms.
Week long history.
Sleep resets at around noon, the rest at midnight.

Eventually, there will be a companion app for Android.

Based on the excellent work by Qian He on On11, the app will be open source soon.
Activity icons from: http://icons8.com/

IMPORTANT NOTES:
1. The app runs in background. If asked, you must let it run in background.
2. It is meant to capture major daily activity and disregard insignificant hand movements and such. I advise you let it run for a day and then check back.
3. The alarm dismiss button must be long pressed(snooze is short press) so you don't do it in your sleep. Don't set the same(or very close) alarm time to another app or inbuilt alarm, this may cause it to fail.

Discussion and feedback at:
https://forums.getpebble.com/discussion/23649/watchapp-uptempo

data.author: Lex Dreitser
data.description:
The Ultimate IoT Wearable. 

Control Your Entire World with Your Watch!
I've made a wearable app for the pebble watch with pebble.js that connects to a Spark Core IoT micro-controller. The spark core is connected to various sensors, relays and coffee makers....

Features:

**Occupancy**- I connected spark core pins A0-A05 to four motion sensors and two reed switches. 
Now I'm able to track motion around my house and instantly know if doors are opened or closed just by looking at my watch. 

**Lights**- I connected spark core pins D0-D2 to relays that switch on/off three outdoor lights. These can now be controlled via my watch instead of having to go downstairs and operate them manually.

**Garage Doors**- I've connected pins D3 and D4 to my garage door openers' switches. I'm now able to open/close both of my garage doors from anywhere, just using my watch.

**Coffee** - I've connected pins D5 and D6 to the switches that operate my coffee machines. I've also created an in-app timer. So now I can not only brew coffee from anywhere, I can tell how fresh it is.

**Drone** - Since most drones have their own restful API, I'm able to control drones using this same app. This part is still in development.

There is plenty of customization possible. If you would like this app customized for you, please contact it's maker at GuruNYC.com
data.title: IoT Control Watch

data.description:
Location sharing. Secure. Simple.

This watchapp looks very much like an ordinary watchface, but really isn't. It detects (right-side) button presses in the following order
"UP-CENTER-DOWN"
and the moment you do press it in said manner your phone sends your location to all the contacts you have chosen on the supporting application, via text message(SMS).

This app hence aims to be a sort of discrete SOS/ location sharing app, that could either be used to track children/old people or used in general emergency situations. 

This concept and design also happens to be the winner of HackIndia-2015 under the category - Use of Pebble smartwatch to create a useful and intuitive  application.


Please do provide any feedback on improvements.

data.description:
# HannaTimer

simple stopwatch for time-flow event.
this app has two mode, that remember previous mode.
change mode `long up click` action.

## LAP TIMER

- time with interval(gap) each stopwatch laps
- retrieve past stopwatch point (marker)

## STOP TIMER

- simply 5 stop timer


## Usage

### lap timer

- up/down : move focus
- select : mark time now
- long select : remove this lap (short vibe feedback, very short vibe feedback if failed)
- long down : clear all laps

### stop timer

- up/down : move focus
- select : start or pause
- long select : reset this timer
- long down : reset all timers

changelog.release_notes:
Fixes bug where some devices would not show the settings page. 
Fixes a UI bug where long move values would get cut off.
I completely rewrote all of the Pebble code. This version should be much faster and efficient. Also, your phone is no longer required to be connected to Pebble once you start a workout.

This update uses a completely new backend and implements timeline pins with useful information. 
Changelog: 
* New backend - cool stats coming soon

* **v3.2**
  * Online Workout Manager
    * Reorder moves by clicking and dragging
    * Create longer moves
  * UI Changes
    * Show timer in minutes and seconds
  * Bug Fixes
    * Font to fit bug for a more consistant layout

This update adds Pebble Time compatibility, a slightly updated layout and fixes several bugs. 

### Changelog

* **v3.1**

  * Pebble Time Compatibility 
    * App now works with Pebble Time and makes use of color screen for various windows. 
  * Updated Layout
    * Move Name and Time larger and centered
    * Move Name font and size changes to accommodate larger moves
  * Bug Fixes
    * Fix bug where text would get cut off by status bar
    * Fix bug that would cause workouts to get stuck on loading after second move. 
    * Miscellaneous bug fixes

This updates adds a new type of move: Repetitions. In a rep move, instead of a countdown, you can click next to advance a rep. 
This update changes the way workouts are stored and thus, it is required to continue enjoying the app. 

v3.0 Changelog
  * New Move type: Repetitions
    * Can now set a move with reps, click next to advance one rep
    * Long press next to go to next move
  * Updated Online Workout Manager
    * Allows for easy adding of rep moves
  * Migrated all workouts to new format
    * This is required and makes the update to 3.0 mandatory. 
  * Code clean-up and bug fixes

This update fixes some critical memory problems from previous versions, and a wakeup bug where some moves would be repeated in a workout.
This update also updates the server address for the Online Workout Manager.

This update includes, among other things, a move preloading feature that significantly improves the speed of the app. 

v2.6 Changelog: 
    Move preloading
        Next move preloads during current move
        Significant performance improvement
    Extended move names
        Long moves can now take up two lines
    Miscellaneous bug fixes and improvements
        Backlight turns on when move changes
        Fixed pause and stop bug

This update implements background timers, new controls (stop,next) and an improved UI. It also fixes several reported bugs and improves performance. 

v2.5: 
  Background timers
     -Timers continue to run even if the app is closed
  New controls during timer. 
     - Stop, play/pause and next
  Improved UI
     - Added ActionBar for new controls
     - Added loading window
  Performance Improvements
  Bug Fixes

This major update to Custom Workout Timer adds an Online Workout Manager with lots of features. 
    * Delete existing workouts/moves
    * Add moves to existing workouts
    * Edit existing moves (name + time)
    * Delete workouts
    * Display total workout time
    * Manage workouts from computer
Release Notes: Initial release. I've tested the app multiple times, but please let me know if you find a bug or have any suggestions!

data.description:
Easily create custom interval timers (with names) for your workouts.  This app will time you and alert you when to change moves based on your own workout program. Example: Plank for 2 minutes, 10 biceps curls, pushups for 45 seconds... etc.   

You can add create workouts and add moves from your phone or your computer. Moves can be time (plank for 1 minute) or rep based (10 pullups). In a time move, you set the length and Pebble will advance to the next move when the countdown timer ends. On a rep move, you can manually advance when you are done with a set/rep. Pebble will advance when you've done all the reps.

After installing, locate this app on the phone's Pebble app, then click on the settings icon. You can add workouts and moves from there.

Fixes a UI bug where long move values would get cut off.

changelog.release_notes:
Fixed a bug where the configuration could get corrupted. It should now prevent that from happening or reset the corrupt value back to the default.

FYI - this was triggered when entering a url and autocorrect added an apostrophe to the name. Gotta love autocorrect.

Also fixed a bug where the devices and actions wouldn't reload automatically after a configuration change.
Fixed a bug where only some of the actions would render properly.
Fixed a bug where devices and actions wouldn't always load when the app started up.

1. Switched to Indigo XML RESTful API which handles Unicode better for our international friends.

2. Added an Item Filter configuration setting which will only return devices/actions that start with the filter value. It strips the filter from the item name. For example, if you have some devices to show on your Pebble, you could name them: PebbleRoom1, PebbleRoom2, and on your watch you will see: Room1 and Room2. This is in lieu of being able to specify a folder that contains the items of interest because that isn't yet supported by Indigo.

3. Various bug fixes and better error handling.

New in 2.0:
- Fixed a bug where the port option would always reset to 8000
- Added support for authenticated connections to Indigo Server
- Added support for Prism Reflector

changelog.release_notes: OFFICIAL SPOTS ! We changed the free spot selection process for a more reliable "official" spot system : Bodhi now works for a selection of more than 3000+ spots all around the world ! The change will be totally transparent, as the system will automatically choose the closest fixed spot around your previous selection. Have a good surf with Bodhi !

OFFICIAL SPOTS ! 
We changed the free spot selection process for a more reliable "official" spot system : Bodhi now works for a selection of more than 3000+ spots all around the world ! The change will be totally transparent, as the system will automatically choose the closest fixed spot around your previous selection. 

Have a good surf with Bodhi !

OFFICIAL SPOTS ! 
We changed the free spot selection process for a more reliable "official" spot system : Bodhi now works for a selection of more than 3000+ spots all around the world ! The change will be totally transparent, as the system will automatically choose the closest fixed spot around your previous selection. 
Have a good surf with Bodhi !

This is a HUGE update for Bodhi ! 

What started as a pet side project quickly become the most downloaded and liked surf app on the Pebble Store. We were trully amazed to see that, but soon we noticed an unfortunate yet logical side effect : the little server powering Bodhi became overwhelm by the increasing number of users, causing problems and slowing down everything.Like everyone, we hate slow and crappy apps, so we decided to act and muscle our game ! 

Bodhi runs now on a much server, and the code has been tuned up to serve both the configuration page and the timeline pins FASTER ! 

We also added a long demanded feature : time frame ! You can now set the time frame for your swell forecasts, in order to just receive them when you can actually surf ! You can set a time for your surf alert as well. 

Like always, thanks for using Bodhi Surf !

Happy surfing

BodhiSurf is now compiled and ready for  Classic Pebble and Pebble Round !
Added a fancy new tide icon as well :)

Adding an option to choose the forecast type : swell or tide or both :)

Merci Brice pour l'idée ;)

Bodhi surf now also speaks Deutsch, Italiano, Português, Français, 日本人 and 中国 !

Also added a parameter to choose how many forecast a day you want on your timeline.

Don't forget : life is short, don't waste it, go surfing ! (and also, give a heart if you like Bodhi Surf !)
Fixed configuration page for Android users
First version on the pebble app store, yay !

data.description:
Bodhi Surf feeds your timeline with swell and tide forecast for your favorite spot anywhere in the world !

Bodhi Surf is freaking easy to use : just pick your favorite spot location, select your forecast parameters and you're good to go !
You can also tell the app what's surf conditions makes you crave for surfing, and it will warn you automatically with dedicated notifications !

Now supports - Deutsch, English, Español, Français, Italiano, Português, 日本人 and 中国.

If you have any problems with this app, or got fresh cool ideas, feel free to mail me ! And of course, if you like the app, give it a heart !

DISCLAIMER : tide data are based on astronomical tide prediction and may not display always the correct height. Do NOT use this app for navigation or any other purpose that may result in personal injury or property damage.

data.description:
Colored circular countdown timer initially designed for fitness sessions.
It's also customisable as a standard timer, interval timer, interval ttopwatch, Pomodoro clock, Tabata or Little HIIT sessions, and more.

Up to 12 timer settings including:
- preparation time (orange segment)
- workout time (green segment)
- harder workout time (purple segment)
- rest time (red segment)
- series count or stopwatch mode
- interval segments and background color
- intervals or round display mode
- timer name
- activity tracker data including step or distance

Timers will vibrate at the end of each segment.
The timer will stop at the end of the last serie in "series count" mode.
Settings are persistent, the timer will wake up on completion if "Series-Timer" goes to the background.

Activity tracker give you a score of movement intensity. You can read the total score on top left. The current serie score is on top right and last serie score on bottom left.

It is a standalone watchapp, doesn't need smartphone connection.

Toggle from round to interval views with long press on up button.

You can change timer names and other settings using the parameter button from the pebble app on your phone.

You can find manual and post comments on http://forums.getpebble.com/discussion/24153/watchapp-sdk3-series-timer-interval-pomodoro-tabata-hiit.

data.description:
This app uses the Pebble's accelerometer to simulate an attitude indicator. The main indicator shows an artificial horizon and degrees of pitch up or down. The bank indicator at the top displays left or right tilt, with markers at 10, 20, 30, 45, and 60 degrees.

By default the backlight is kept on, although it can be turned off by pressing the top right button and waiting a few seconds.

Because an accelerometer is used and not a gyroscope, this app is only accurate while stopped or at a constant velocity, not while turning. I would not recommend using this for navigation anyway. ;)

data.description:
Designed for pilots, the  ZuluTimer provides UTC time (aka Zulu time) along with a countdown/countup timer. In countdown mode the timer vibrates in the last few seconds before zero, then starts counting up. On Pebble Time watches the color of the timer reflects down/up mode. Colors are configurable via the Pebble app.

The countdown preset is adjusted by using the up and down buttons while the timer is stopped. Pressing the select button starts and stops the timer. Long press on the up button at any time reloads the preset time and starts counting down. Long press on the down button sets the timer to zero and starts counting up.

If you navigate away, the app will continue to count in the background and will re-open and vibrate when the timer is about to expire.

latest_release.release_notes: Now works correctly on original Pebble (Aplite platform.) Added configuration page with color pickers for Basalt. Timer preset can be set from configuration page. Timer can exceed 99 minutes up or down.

data.description:
Meu Ponto é um aplicativo para controlar os seus horários de entrada e saída do trabalho e saldo total de horas.

Meu Ponto para o Pebble permite que você registre os horários na sua conta do Meu Ponto, em tempo real, diretamente do seu Pebble.

Você poderá editar e ajustar tudo através do Meu Ponto em seu browser caso necessário.

Antes de usar o Meu Ponto para o Pebble, você precisa:
- Registrar-se no Meu Ponto em: http://meu-ponto.appspot.com/
- Acessar o menu "Configurações" no website
- Selecionar a opção "Integração" e confirmar
- Copiar as informações fornecidas (User e Token)
- Abrir "Settings" do Meu Ponto no Aplicativo Pebble do seu telefone
- Inserir as informações copiadas e salvar

Controles:

Botão UP
- clique curto: muda o tipo de registro
- clique longo: envia um registro usando os dados da tela

Botão SELECT
- clique curto: volta 1 minuto
- clique longo: muda para a hora/minuto atual

Botão DOWN
- clique curto: volta 1 dia
- clique longo: muda para a data atual

data.description:
Get Me There is a public transit schedule app designed for commuters and frequent public transit users. Upon launch the app will display the upcoming departure times for nearby stops, with all modes of public transit supported. The app also corrects for real-time departures where data is available.

Get Me There has many unique features such as the ability to set favorite stops, add departure times to your timeline, and where available, Get Me There will display real-time departure times so you'll know exactly when your train will arrive.

Get Me There is currently available in the following cities:
Philadelphia*
New York City*
Chicago
San Francisco*
DC/Baltimore
Boston
Denver
Miami
Seattle
Portland
Dallas
Detroit
State College, PA
and more!


You're in the city shopping and going to a show and you don't know where the nearest public transit stops are? No problem, launch Get Me There and you are immediately presented with the nearest public transit stations.

You're at work, or you still have a last minute project to finish, and you want to know when the next few buses or trains are coming? No problem, launch Get Me There and you'll immediately know when the next ten buses/trains are coming so you can plan your work accordingly.  You can even see when each train will arrive at your destination.  The real-time feature will tell you exactly when your train will arrive, not just the scheduled time, so you're never left there standing in the non-air conditioned station waiting minutes on end for your late train.

data.description:
Patris is a game inspired by the famous classic falling blocks.

The game is automatically saved when you exit the app and you can change level in the menu.

This app was developed using formal proof with SPARK2014, see more at http://blog.adacore.com/make-with-ada-formal-proof-on-my-wrist

Controls:
